title: A JSON Schema for FinSpec v2.1.

finspec.description: The FinSpec version of this document.

info.description: General information about the author of the API.

version.description: A semantic version number of the API.

issuer.description: The name of the API issuer.

issueDate.description: The issue date of the API description expressed in YYYY-MM-DD format.

liveDate.description: The anticipated production-live date of the API description expressed in YYYY-MM-DD format.

title.description: A unique and precise title of the API service.

logo.description: A fully-qualified URL to a suitable logo image for the spec author.

status.description: A description of the current state of this specification (eg DRAFT or FINAL).

contacts.description: List of contact details for the owners of the API.

contact.description: Contact detail of a person or department within the API owner.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

phone.description: The phone number (including international dialing code) for the contact.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization.

protocol.description: Metadata about the protocol used by the API.

name.description: The common name for the protocol.

description.description: An optional description of the protocol.

isFIX.description: Is this the FIX protocol? (Useful short-cut for one of the most popular protocols).

isOffsetBased.description: Is this a offset-based message such as ITCH?

isTagValue.description: Is the protocol tag-value based, such as FIX or SWIFT?

isObject.description: Does the specification describe the set of object attributes returned from an SDK?

isBinary.description: Indicates whether protocol is text or binary.

endianness.description: Default endianness of numerical types for binary/native APIs.

charset.description: Legal character set used for string values e.g. 'UTF8', 'ISO 8859-1', etc.

hasHeader.description: Do messages in this protocol always have a defined header block?

hasTrailer.description: Do messages in this protocol always have a defined trailer (footer) block?

changes.description: An optional block providing a description of changes in this, and prior, spec versions.

summary.description: A HTML or text description of the latest changes made.

lastVersion.description: The version number of the immediately prior spec version (i.e. the starting spec to which changes have been applied).

lastVersionDate.description: The date of the immediately prior spec version (i.e. the starting spec to which changes have been applied) in YYYY-MM-DD format.

history.description: An optional block providing a description of changes in prior, spec versions.

version.description: The spec version number to which this history record relates.

issueDate.description: The issue date of the spec to which this history record relates, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

liveDate.description: The live date of the spec version to which this history record relates, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

summary.description: A HTML or text description of the changes applied in the indicated spec version.

datatypes.description: List of datatypes used by the API.

datatype.description: Description of a specific datatype used by the API.

name.description: Name of the type. e.g. int, uint8e, Price, Boolean, etc.

baseType.description: Specifies the base/raw data type of the value.

length.description: Length of value for this type in number of bytes.

precision.description: Precision for floating point type value.

isUnsigned.description: Whether numerical value is unsigned or not. Default: false

isBitField.description: Whether type represents a bit field. Default: false

pattern.description: Regular expression to describe the pattern of the value for this datatype.

padSide.description: Whether field value should be padded to left or right.

blocks.description: A re-usable field block (such as common header of trailer).

messages.description: List of messages supported by this API spec.

info.description: Informational messages which do not contain fields.

technical.description: Messages used for establishing, maintaining and closing API sessions.

key.description: Unique identifier (key) for the information section, as indicated in the nav block.

historyKey.description: Linking identifier that is persisted across spec versions for this object, facilitating cross-version comparison.

fieldSet.description: Description of a set of fields (message or block) within the API.

wireId.description: Unique, wire identifier for the message (eg tag 35 in FIX).

description.description: Description of the purpose and use of the message.

key.description: Unique identifier (key) for the message, as indicated in the corresponding block.

historyKey.description: Linking identifier that is persisted across spec versions for this object, facilitating cross-version comparison.

isSession.description: Whether this fieldset relates to establishing, maintaining or terminating an API session.

isHeader.description: Whether this fieldset describes a re-usable header block.

isTrailer.description: Whether this fieldset describes a re-usable trailer (footer) block.

direction.description: Indication of message flow. Default is both.

fieldSetWithContext.description: Description of a functional (context-specific) application-level message within the API.

wireId.description: Wire identifier for the message (eg tag 35 in FIX).

description.description: Description of the purpose and use of the message.

isSession.description: Whether this fieldset relates to establishing, maintaining or terminating an API session.

key.description: Unique identifier (key) for the message, as indicated in the corresponding block.

baseKey.description: Unique identifier (key) for the technical message upon which this functional view is based.

historyKey.description: Linking identifier that is persisted across spec versions for this object, facilitating cross-version comparison.

direction.description: Indication of message flow. Default is both.

fieldArray.description: List of fields available within a fieldset (message or block).

field.description: Description of a specific field within a fieldSet (message or block).

offset.description: Zero-based offset of the field within the message for binary APIs.

position.description: Zero-based position of the field within the message for text/tag-value APIs. Where absent, ordering should be assumed from positioning within the JSON.

wireId.description: Wire identifier for the field (eg tag 35 in FIX).

key.description: The unique reference for the field.

blockKey.description: The unique reference for the block from the `blocks` section.

description.description: Description of the purpose and use of the field.

datatype.description: Field datatype from the list of API datatypes.

minValue.description: Minimum permitted field value for numeric types.

maxValue.description: Maximum permitted field value for numeric types.

exclusiveMinValue.description: Whether 'minValue' value is exclusive or not.

exclusiveMaxValue.description: Whether 'maxValue' value is exclusive or not.

minLength.description: Minimum permitted length of value for string types.

maxLength.description: Maximum permitted length of value for string types.

length.description: Field value length in number of bytes (binary) or characters (text).

values.description: List of possible values for this field.

pattern.description: Regular expression to describe the pattern of the value for this field.

alwaysRequired.description: Boolean flag to indicate that this field is present in 100% of cases. Default: false

fields.description: List of nested fields, indicating a repeating group under the current field.

bits.description: Details about how bits are organized in current bit field.

expressionType.description: Type of grammar used in expression field. Default: groovy.

expression.description: Expression. The message context is considered to be in effect if this expression evaluates to true.

example.description: An example of an object, such as a field or fieldset.

bit.description: Description of a specific bit within a group of bits.

offset.description: Bit offset within this bit group.

values.description: List of possible values for this bit.

enumArray.description: List of possible values for a field.

enum.description: Description of an enumerated, valid value.

wireValue.description: Enumeration as it appears on the wire.

name.description: Short, common name for this enumeration.

expressionType.description: Type of grammar used in expression field.

expression.description: Condition expression. Below block matters if this expression evaluates to true.

isReqd.description: Field is mandatory in such conditions

isAbsent.description: Field should not be present in such conditions

values.description: Restricted set of permitted enumerations when the conditions described above are true

functional.description: Navigation for all functional views (context-specific fieldsets).

navSection.description: Navigation section containing further menu items.

navSubSection.description: Navigation sub-section containing further menu items.

key.description: Unique key linking for the information section or fieldset. Links to the key found in the relevant blocks or messages object

name.description: Name of the section or fieldset.

workflows.description: Description of the specific business case modelled in the workflow.

nav.description: List of messages included in the workflow

states.description: Set of states available in this workflow

events.description: Set of events available in this workflow

transitions.description: List of events that causes the workflow to transition to another state

state.description: Individual state composing of the workflow

nav.description: Unique reference of the related workflow

isInitial.description: This is the initial state of the workflow.

isFinal.description: This is the final state of the workflow.

isDefaultError.description: Is this the default rejection state-message?

event.description: Individual event available in the workflow

time.description: Time in UTC when event is triggered HH:MM:SS

transition.description: details of the transition phase with triggering action and end state

key.description: key of the message or event

messageKey.description: key of the message or event

isSuccess.description: Is this a successful response to the action

with.description: Conditions to determine the value of the field

date.description: date to be computed in the following format YYYYMMDD. Can also be a compute instruction like TODAY, YESTERDAY

time.description: Time in timestampUTC. Can also be a compute instruction like NOW

this.description: tag of the field from which the value is copied - in this message

last.description: tag of the field from which the value is copied - in previous linked message

default.description: Default value if not compute from another field

min.description: Min value of this field - used for integer fields

max.description: Max value of this field - used for integer fields

withIf.description: Signifying the block with different set of conditions

withCondition.description: Conditional with block for specify the conditional values

condition.description: tag condition expressed in groovy expression

vendorExtension.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

notesArray.description: Public notes at different levels: Spec, Message, Block or Field

note.description: A HTML or text note content.

updated_at.description: Time the note was last updated in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS format
